results.title: Life is What You Make It
results.brief_description: Bob Bloch and Frank Arndt are both war veterans with very different stories but these men have the same vibrant enthusiasm for life. Bob Bloch ran the Meeniyan Pharmacy for over fifty years while living out his boyhood dream of becoming a pilot and restoring vintage cars. Frank Arndt, while a newcomer to the town, feels he has finally found his rightful place in Meeniyan and is heavily involved in community activities such as contract bridge and table tennis.

results.title: Lend Us a Hand
results.brief_description: Like all small towns, Mirboo North survives on the support of its dedicated volunteers. This film features some of the many volunteer groups that are active in Mirboo North. From the local Op Shop to the Wednesday Warriors and the Mirboo North Times, it captures the community spirit of giving.

results.title: A Day in the Life of a Dairy Farm
results.brief_description: From sunrise to sunset, seven days a week, 365 days a year, a dairy farmer knows no rest. Spend a day with Les and Louise Calder on their dairy farm and observe a typical day’s activities. From artificial insemination to feeding and twice daily milking, come rain, hail or shine, these farmers work from dusk till dawn, everyday.

results.title: Connecting Towns: A South Gippsland Cluster
results.brief_description: Take a tour through four small picturesque towns in South Gippsland that are combining their resources to create opportunities for growth. Here we meet some locals from Bena, Loch, Poowong and Nyora, in their places of significance as they reflect on personal memories and describe the uniqueness of where they live.

results.title: Artists of Mt Best
results.creator_credit: Kim Montgomery, Dean Lawry and ACMI
results.brief_description: Mt Best is full of artists who have been inspired by the beauty, changing light and drama of this region in the Strezlecki Ranges. In this film we meet painters, photographers and musicians who talk about what drew them to the area, how the weather informs their work and how the community inspire each other.

results.title: Castlemaine Community Lunch
results.brief_description: The Castlemaine Community Lunch is a weekly event organised by the Castlemaine Community House. It brings people together in a warm and welcoming environment, encouraging and nurturing friendships and connections. Attended by locals, old and new, it is also a chance to welcome newcomers into the community.

results.title: Shani
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: Dynamic 18 year old Shani Aziz is a hip hop dancer living in the small town of Maldon where she runs the local fish and chip shop with her mother. She started hip hop dancing with her brother as something fun to do but it has become her passion leading her to start a not-for-profit group to empower young people. She is an inspirational teacher offering the youth of the small Victorian town an outlet for fun and self expression.

results.title: The Newstead Swimming Pool
results.creator_credit: Csilla Csongvay, Kim Montgomery and ACMI
results.brief_description: The Newstead Pool is an important hub of this Victorian town and a community hang-out that gets very lively in the summer. It is run by more than 50 volunteers and is a place for the community to gather and socialise, and has also been known for a sneaky skinny dip.
